sentences.english: But Anna combine not ashamed embarrassed, return just expose that kind of the color of the grudge.
sentences.chinese: 可是安娜並不羞窘，還只是露着那種怨恨之色。

sentences.english: I was embarrassed at his question.
sentences.chinese: 他的問題使我感到很窘。

sentences.english: His face crimsoned when he saw her.
sentences.chinese: 瑪姬感到很窘，接著臉色變得通紅。

sentences.english: They were too much absorbed in their mutual joy to suffer embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 他們過於沉浸在相互歡樂裏，一點兒不覺得窘。

sentences.english: The tricky question about his finances discomfited the minister.
sentences.chinese: 一個有關部長的財源方面的微妙問題使他感到很窘。

sentences.english: I was surprised and embarrassed. I sat down. I helped her with the socks.
sentences.chinese: 我又驚又窘地坐了下來，幫她穿襪子。

sentences.english: The reader gets the impression that Mr McLaren may be embarrassed by such soppiness .
sentences.chinese: 讀者感到麥克拉倫也許窘於這些情感。

sentences.english: They were embarrassed because there was not enough food for all the guests.
sentences.chinese: 因爲食物不夠給所有的客人，他們覺得很窘。

sentences.english: Donsistency is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
sentences.chinese: 接氣性，是無想象力窘蹙者最後的藉口。

sentences.english: He was rather hard up for a time.
He embarrassed me with a difficult question.
The Flock fell silent, and Jonathan fidgeted in embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 鷗羣安靜下來，喬納森感到很窘，不知所措。

sentences.english: The interviewer had driven her into a corner.
sentences.chinese: 採訪者把她追問得很窘。

sentences.english: She was so embarrassed, she wished the earth would open and swallow her up.
sentences.chinese: 她窘死了，巴不得地上能開一個口子把她吞下去。

definition: dry rations (for a journey)/(dialect) (of noodles etc) to become mush (from overcooking)/(coll.) embarrassing/embarrassment
